types.name: Action
types.description: An action to run after the install is complete.

fields.name: action
fields.description: The action to run.

fields.name: after
fields.description: What to do with the original file after running the action.

fields.name: client
fields.description: If this action should be run for client side use.

fields.name: mod
fields.description: A list of `name` attributes of mods to run this action on. For `createzip` action, this is a list of mods that will be extracted and combined into a single zip. For `rename` action this will be a singular mod (in a list) to rename.

fields.name: saveAs
fields.description: The filename to save the output of the action to.

fields.name: server
fields.description: If this action should be run for server side use.

fields.name: type
fields.description: When `action` is `createzip`, this is the type of the resulting file and where it should be placed.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: ActionAction
types.description: The decomp type of this mod and where the decompressed file should be placed.

types.name: ActionType
types.description: The decomp type of this mod and where the decompressed file should be placed.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Configs
types.description: The information about the configs bundle. This can be downloaded from `${CDN_URL}/packs/${PACK_NAME}/versions/${PACK_VERSION}/Configs.zip`

fields.name: filesize
fields.description: The filesize of the configs bundle.

fields.name: sha1
fields.description: The SHA1 hash of the configs bundle.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

types.name: DecompType
types.description: The decomp type of this mod and where the decompressed file should be placed.

types.name: Delete
types.description: A file/folder to be deleted.

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base directory used for deleting files/folders.

fields.name: target
fields.description: The file/folder within the base path to delete.

types.name: DeleteBase
types.description: The base directory used for deleting files/folders.

types.name: Deletes
types.description: A list of files/folders that should be deleted when updating to this version.

fields.name: files
fields.description: A list of files to be deleted.

fields.name: folders
fields.description: A list of folders to be deleted.

types.name: Download
types.description: The download type of this mod and how the `url` property should be downloaded.

types.name: ExtraArguments
types.description: Any extra arguments that should be used when launching a client instance.

fields.name: arguments
fields.description: The argumenrs to apply when launching a client instance.

fields.name: depends
fields.description: If this is set, it requires that a mod with the given name be selected for install (either by the user or is defaulted to be installed). If it was not selected, this arguments should not apply.

fields.name: dependsGroup
fields.description: If this is set, it requires that any mod with the given group be selected for install (either by the user or is defaulted to be installed). If none were selected, this arguments should not apply.

types.name: ExtractTo
types.description: Where a mod archive should be extracted to.

types.name: FabricLoaderVersion
types.description: A version of the Fabric modloader.

types.name: FabricLoaderVersionsOrderByDirection
types.description: The direction in which to sort the results by.

types.name: FabricLoaderVersionsOrderByField
types.description: How to order the results.

types.name: ForgeVersion
types.description: A version of the Forge modloader.

types.name: ForgeVersionsOrderByDirection
types.description: The direction in which to sort the results by.

types.name: ForgeVersionsOrderByField
types.description: How to order the results.

types.name: Java
types.description: The version of Java needed to run.

types.name: JavaRuntime
types.description: A version of Minecraft.

types.name: JavaRuntimeOS
types.description: The OS for a Java Runtime.

types.name: KeepFiles
types.description: A file to be saved between updates.

fields.name: base
fields.description: The base directory used for saving files.

fields.name: target
fields.description: The file within the base path to keep.

types.name: KeepFilesBase
types.description: The base directory used for saving files between updates.

types.name: LauncherInstallMethod
types.description: The install method of the launcher.

types.name: LauncherModPackResult
types.description: The definition for a modpack result.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: LegacyFabricLoaderVersion
types.description: A version of the LegacyFabric modloader.

types.name: LegacyFabricLoaderVersionsOrderByDirection
types.description: The direction in which to sort the results by.

types.name: LegacyFabricLoaderVersionsOrderByField
types.description: How to order the results.

types.name: Library
types.description: A library to be installed and loaded into the classpath when launching an instance.

fields.name: depends
fields.description: If this is set, it requires that a mod with the given name be selected for install (either by the user or is defaulted to be installed). If it was not selected, this library should not be downloaded.

fields.name: dependsGroup
fields.description: If this is set, it requires that any mod with the given group be selected for install (either by the user or is defaulted to be installed). If none were selected, this library should not be downloaded.

fields.name: download
fields.description: The download type of this library and how the `url` property should be downloaded.

fields.name: file
fields.description: The filename of this library. This can differ from the filename in the url.

fields.name: filesize
fields.description: The filesize of the file.

fields.name: force
fields.description: If this library should be forced to download regardless of if it already exists and has the correct hash.

fields.name: md5
fields.description: The MD5 hash of the file.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path of the library that the file should be downloaded to and added to the classpath on the client side.

fields.name: server
fields.description: The path of the library that the file should be downloaded to and added to the classpath on the client side.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The url of this library. In the case of `download` property being `SERVER`, this **MAY** be a partial url which should be added to the end of a compatible ATLauncher cdn.

types.name: Loader
types.description: The definition for a mod loader.

fields.name: choose
fields.description: If the user can choose the version of the mod loader they want.

fields.name: className
fields.description: The classname of the loader for use in ATLauncher.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata for the mod loader.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of mod loader to install and use.

types.name: LoaderMetadata
types.description: The definition for a pack version.

fields.name: installerSha1
fields.description: The SHA1 hash of the installer.

fields.name: installerSize
fields.description: The filesize of the installer.

fields.name: loader
fields.description: The specific version of Fabric/Quilt loader to install.

fields.name: minecraft
fields.description: The Minecraft version this mod loader is for.

fields.name: rawVersion
fields.description: The raw version of the mod loader to use. This is only used for Forge when they prefix the Minecraft versions onto some of their versions.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the mod loader to use.

fields.name: yarn
fields.description: The specific version of Yarn mappings to install.

types.name: LoaderVersions
types.description: The loaders and versions for a version of Minecraft.

types.name: LoginResult
types.description: The result of a login.

types.name: MainClass
types.description: The main class used when launching an instance of this pack version. Shouldn't be used when combined with a `loader`.

fields.name: depends
fields.description: If this is set, it requires that a mod with the given name be selected for install (either by the user or is defaulted to be installed). If it was not selected, this main class should not apply.

fields.name: dependsGroup
fields.description: If this is set, it requires that any mod with the given group be selected for install (either by the user or is defaulted to be installed). If none were selected, this main class should not apply.

fields.name: mainClass
fields.description: The main class used when launching an instance of this pack version. Shouldn't be used when combined with a `loader`.

types.name: Messages
types.description: Messages that should be shown to the user when installing/updating.

fields.name: install
fields.description: The message to show at the start of an install.

fields.name: update
fields.description: The message to show at the start of an update.

types.name: MinecraftVersion
types.description: A version of Minecraft.

types.name: MinecraftVersionType
types.description: The type Minecraft version.

types.name: Mod
types.description: The definition for a mod.

fields.name: authors
fields.description: The authors of this mod.

fields.name: client
fields.description: If this mod should be downloaded and installed for client side use.

fields.name: colour
fields.description: The key of the colour in the root `colours` property that should be applied to this mod.

fields.name: decompFile
fields.description: The file that was within the decompressed archive that should be placed where `decompType` defines.

fields.name: decompType
fields.description: The decomp type of this mod and where the decompressed file should be placed.

fields.name: depends
fields.description: The dependencies of this mod. If this mod is installed (either by default by being non optional, or being optional and selected by the user), then the list of names of mods in this property should also be installed.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the mod.

fields.name: donation
fields.description: The link to a donation page for the mod.

fields.name: download
fields.description: The download type of this mod and how the `url` property should be downloaded.

fields.name: extractFolder
fields.description: The folder inside the zip of this mod that should be extracted out (as set by `extractTo`).

fields.name: extractTo
fields.description: This defines that the mod download should be extracted to the location given. Can be optionally combined with `extractFolder` to extract a specific folder out of the archive.

fields.name: file
fields.description: The filename of this mod. This can differ from the filename in the url. Note that `filePrefix`, if it is defined, should be prefixed to any final filename.

fields.name: filePrefix
fields.description: A prefix that should be applied to the start of the `file` attribute.

fields.name: filesize
fields.description: The filesize of the file.

fields.name: force
fields.description: If this mod should be forced to download regardless of if it already exists and has the correct hash.

fields.name: group
fields.description: The group that this mod belongs to. Only one mod within a group can be selected.

fields.name: hidden
fields.description: If the mod should be hidden from view of the user installing it. Most commonly used with `depends` and `library` properties.

fields.name: library
fields.description: If this mod is a library. These mods should only be installed if it's a dependant mod (meaning another mod which has this mods name in their `depends` property) and that mod was selected (or is default seleted or non optional).

fields.name: linked
fields.description: When an optional mod is selected/deselected, all mods that have this `linked` attribute set to the name of that mod should also be selected/deselected to match the linked mod.

fields.name: md5
fields.description: The MD5 hash of the file.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this mod.

fields.name: optional
fields.description: If this mod is optional for client side installs and the user must select it for it to be downloaded and used.

fields.name: recommended
fields.description: If this mod is recommended to be installed. This applies only to optional mods.

fields.name: selected
fields.description: If this mod should be selected by default if it is an optional mod.

fields.name: server
fields.description: If this mod should be downloaded and installed for server side use.

fields.name: serverDownload
fields.description: The download type for the server mod. Used only when `serverSeparate` is true.

fields.name: serverFile
fields.description: The filename of the server file. Used only when `serverSeparate` is true.

fields.name: serverMd5
fields.description: The MD5 hash of the server file. Used only when `serverSeparate` is true.

fields.name: serverOptional
fields.description: If this mod is optional for server side installs and the user must select it for it to be downloaded and used.

fields.name: serverSeparate
fields.description: If this mod has a separate download when building a server. If true then see `serverUrl`, `serverType`, `serverFile`, `serverDownload` and `serverMd5` properties

fields.name: serverType
fields.description: The type of server version of the mod. Used only when `serverSeparate` is true.

fields.name: serverUrl
fields.description: The url of server version of the mod. Used only when `serverSeparate` is true.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of mod this is. This dictates how and where the mod file needs to be installed.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The url of this mod. In the case of `download` property being `SERVER`, this **MAY** be a partial url which should be added to the end of a compatible ATLauncher cdn.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of this mod.

fields.name: warning
fields.description: The key of the warning in the root `warnings` property that should be shown to the user (with a Yes/No option) when selecting this optional mod. The mod should be unselected if the user selects the No option.

fields.name: website
fields.description: The link to the website for the mod.

fields.name: actions

fields.name: caseAllFiles

fields.name: colours

fields.name: keep

fields.name: libraries
fields.description: A list of libraries that should be downloaded and installed. This should not be used when `loader` is defined.

fields.name: loader

fields.name: mainClass
fields.description: The main class used when launching an instance of this pack version. Shouldn't be used when combined with a `loader`.

fields.name: memory
fields.description: The recommended memory (in MB) that should be used when launching an instance of this pack version.

fields.name: messages

fields.name: noConfigs

fields.name: permgen
fields.description: The recommended permgen/metaspace (in MB) that should be used when launching an instance of this pack version.

fields.name: serverArguments
fields.description: Any extra arguments that should be used when launching a server instance.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
